text: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
author: Harold Abelson

text: The limits of my language mean the limits of my world.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

text: Truth is ever to be found in simplicity, and not in the multiplicity and confusion of things.
author: Isaac Newton

text: Simplicity is the soul of efficiency.
author: Austin Freeman

text: The most damaging phrase in the language is: 'We've always done it this way.'
author: Grace Hopper

text: The code you write makes you a programmer. The code you delete makes you a good one.
author: Mario Fusco

text: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
author: John Johnson

text: I am a human being; nothing human is alien to me.
author: Terence

text: One day, someone will ask you to build something impossible. Say yes.
author: Unknown
